definitions: To intercept and hold something that has been thrown, dropped, or is falling.
To capture (a person or animal), especially after a chase.
To discover someone doing something wrong or secret.
To manage to see or hear (something).
To be in time to get on (a train, bus, or other form of transport).
examples: She catches the ball with one hand.
The police officer catches the thief.
He catches a cold every winter.
The show catches the mood of the era.
The bright color catches her eye.
